header.title: jManage - Web and Command Line Based JMX Client

section.title: jManage Overview
section.p:
jManage is a open source, web and command-line based JMX client, which provides a centralized console for managing application clusters and distributed application production environments.
We are currently developing version 0.5, which has the following features:
- Web based interface, which allows jManage to be used from behind firewall
- Complete security - application server passwords are encrypted
- Command line interface - can be used standalone or with jmanage server
- Support for different J2EE app servers
- Cluster level view of MBeans. Also allows changing attribute values and performing operations at the cluster level.
- Authentication and fine-grained Authorization
- Configuring Applications in jManage
- Runtime Graphing - This has been moved out of 0.5 release
jManage is being built keeping security in mind, as the main target usage of jManage is in the production environment. Production environments usually have limited access and are managed by an operations team. jManage lets the operations team monitor the production environment (via browser or command line) and also allows the operations team to give controlled access to developers, QA and others. Operations team can create jManage users and assign roles to these users. Access to different features can be controlled by assigining permissions to various roles. Permission can be granted even at the level of MBean attributes or operations.
jManage 0.5 early access versions are available on the
downloads page.

section.title: jManage Platform
section.p:
jManage is a Struts and Jetty based web application, which provides both web and command line interface to manage JMX enabled applications. jManage 0.5 version (in development) currently supports the following servers:
- JBoss
- JMX Remoting (JSR 160)
- Bea Weblogic
- IBM WebSphere
jManage command line interface uses java serialization over HTTP to connect to the jManage web application. This allows the command line client to talk to the jmanage server across the firewall.

section.title: Typical Deployment
section.p:
jManage is typically deployed in a production environment in the same network as the applications to be managed. This allows jManage to access the JMX enabled applications via any JMX remoting protocol supported by that application. Users access jManage over HTTP via a web browser or command line.
Access to jManage is controlled via username/password provided by the System Administrators or the Operations team. Admins can control access even at the MBean attribute or operation level.
User activites are logged in a log file, which can be audited by the System Administrators.
